data.title: SITUATION
questions: In this phase, fully explore their current situation and challenges.
Ask questions selectively to gather information/background:
What's going on in your world/business right now?
What's impacting your part of the business?
How would you describe your current situation?
What challenges are you facing? Your team/unit?
In what specific ways is the challenge hindering you/your team?
How is the challenge perhaps helping you/your team?

data.title: PROBLEM
questions: In this phase, foster a full description of their specific problem.
What do you worry about? What’s keeping you up at night?
How satisfied (or dissatisfied) are you with how things are going?
What specific difficulties have you had with…?
What issues continue to be unresolved?
What challenges have you found getting resolution?
What seems to be the crux of the problem?
Why do you think it’s such a problem?

data.title: IMPLICATION
questions: In this phase, surface the significance and implications of their problem.
Ask questions to get at inferences/impacts of the Problem:
What effect is this having on operations, customers, etc.?
If not addressed, what could this lead to…?
What could this potentially mean down the road?
What are the implications for other areas of your business?
How significant are these impacts—if they were to occur?
What potential impacts do you perhaps not even realize?

data.title: NEED + PAYOFF
questions: In this phase, enable them to realize the need to solve their problem.
Ask questions to make implicit needs more explicit…
…and to reinforce the positive elements of your solution:
How important is it that you solve this?
What would solving this do for you…specifically?
How else could solving this benefit your team/organization?
What would the payoff be for you personally?
What’s the danger/downside of not solving it?
What can you not afford to let happen? How so?
What if I could share a way to address/tackle this?
Would you be interested in hearing more?
